siccom.gui

Class TimedDisplayAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • siccom.gui.TimedDisplayAlgorithm

  • public class TimedDisplayAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements an algorithm that will compute a periodically visual update during simulation time instead after every or an amount of steps.
    The Schedule class simplifies the process to implement this simple extension because the method visualUpdate(SimState) is only called once for a time on the time scale: several event with the same time are processed in a single step. This class depends on this behaviour, so it should not be modified in later version of MASON.
    An instance of this class can be configured to force a periodically update after a defined amount of simulation time or when a given time has elapsed (possibly skipping time). Forcing the periodically behaviour this class creates an event that will be scheduled after each invocation of visualUpdate(SimState).
    Author:
    hoehne

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimedDisplayAlgorithm

        public TimedDisplayAlgorithm(sim.display.GUIState simulation,
                             double firstUpdate,
                             double dTime,
                             boolean createOwnEvents)
        The constructor of this visual timer.
        Parameters:
        simulation - The simulation, see Display2D.
        firstUpdate - The time of the first visual update. This simulation time has to elapsed first before a visual update will occur.
        dTime - The (minimum) time between two successive visual updates.
        createOwnEvents - Force a visual update even if no simulation progress occurred during two successive visual updates.

        public final void setDTime(double time)

      • getRecentUpdate

        public final double getRecentUpdate()
        Return the simulation when the recent visual update occurred.
        Returns:
        the recentUpdate

      • visualUpdate

        public boolean visualUpdate(sim.engine.SimState state)
        The method that will return true if a visual update should be performed for the invoking display; false otherwise. This method tests if the elapsed time since the recent visual update is equal or greater than defined in dTime. If this condition is met:
        • The time for the next visual update is calculated.
        • If necessary an event to ensure the visual update is created.
        • True will be returned.
        Return false otherwise.
